general_city_data.description: São Paulo is a sprawling metropolis, the financial heart of Brazil, and one of the largest cities in the world. It's a vibrant hub of culture, gastronomy, and business, offering a diverse range of experiences. From world-class museums and art galleries to bustling markets and a thriving nightlife, São Paulo caters to every taste. The city's diverse population is reflected in its eclectic architecture, cuisine, and cultural events. Despite its size, São Paulo boasts numerous parks and green spaces, providing a welcome respite from the urban hustle. Be prepared for a fast-paced environment and a sensory overload, but also for a truly unforgettable experience.
general_city_data.weather: Subtropical climate with distinct seasons. Summers (December-February) are hot and humid, while winters (June-August) are mild and relatively dry. Rainfall is common throughout the year.
general_city_data.attractions: Ibirapuera Park, Paulista Avenue, MASP (São Paulo Museum of Art), Mercado Municipal (Municipal Market), Pinacoteca do Estado de São Paulo, Liberdade (Japanese neighborhood), Vila Madalena (bohemian neighborhood), Catedral da Sé.
general_city_data.history: Founded in 1554 by Jesuit missionaries, São Paulo remained a small town for centuries. The coffee boom in the 19th century transformed it into a major economic center, attracting immigrants from around the world. Rapid industrialization in the 20th century further fueled its growth, making it the largest city in Brazil and a global metropolis.

points_of_interest.name: Ibirapuera Park
points_of_interest.description_poi: São Paulo's largest and most famous park, offering green spaces, museums, auditoriums, and cultural events.
points_of_interest.address: Av. Pedro Álvares Cabral - Vila Mariana, São Paulo - SP, 04094-050, Brazil

opening_hours.general: Open daily from 5:00 AM to 12:00 AM

points_of_interest.name: Avenida Paulista
points_of_interest.description_poi: A major avenue in São Paulo, known for its cultural institutions, shopping, restaurants, and vibrant atmosphere.
points_of_interest.address: Avenida Paulista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil

points_of_interest.name: MASP - Museu de Arte de São Paulo Assis Chateaubriand
points_of_interest.description_poi: One of the most important art museums in Brazil, known for its collection of European and Brazilian art, as well as its distinctive architecture.
points_of_interest.address: Av. Paulista, 1578 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, 01310-200, Brazil

opening_hours.general: Tue-Sun 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM, Thu 10:00 AM - 8:00 PM, Closed on Mondays

points_of_interest.name: Mercado Municipal de São Paulo (Mercadão)
points_of_interest.description_poi: A historic public market offering a wide variety of food products, including fruits, vegetables, meats, cheeses, and spices.
points_of_interest.address: R. Cantareira, 306 - Centro Histórico de São Paulo, São Paulo - SP, 01024-000, Brazil

opening_hours.general: Mon-Sat 6:00 AM - 6:00 PM, Sun & Holidays 6:00 AM - 4:00 PM

points_of_interest.name: Theatro Municipal de São Paulo
points_of_interest.description_poi: A historic theater known for its stunning architecture and performances of opera, ballet, and classical music.
points_of_interest.address: Praça Ramos de Azevedo, s/n - República, São Paulo - SP, 01037-010, Brazil

opening_hours.general: Varies depending on performance schedule. Check website for details.

points_of_interest.name: Liberdade District
points_of_interest.description_poi: São Paulo's Japanese district, known for its vibrant street markets, Japanese restaurants, and cultural events.

points_of_interest.name: Pinacoteca do Estado de São Paulo
points_of_interest.description_poi: An art museum with a focus on Brazilian art from the 19th century to the present day.
points_of_interest.address: Praça da Luz, 2 - Luz, São Paulo - SP, 01020-010, Brazil

opening_hours.general: Wed-Mon 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM, Closed on Tuesdays

itinerary_response.overall_description: This itinerary offers a glimpse into the vibrant heart of São Paulo, catering to a flexible schedule and budget. It balances iconic landmarks with cultural experiences, allowing for spontaneous exploration. From the bustling Avenida Paulista to the serene Ibirapuera Park, this journey captures the diverse spirit of this dynamic metropolis. Embrace the Paulista energy, savor the culinary delights, and discover the hidden gems that make São Paulo a truly unforgettable destination. This itinerary prioritizes key attractions within a 5km radius of central locations, accommodating various transportation preferences and paces.

points_of_interest.name: Avenida Paulista
points_of_interest.description_poi: Avenida Paulista is São Paulo's most iconic avenue, a bustling hub of commerce, culture, and entertainment. Stroll along its length, admire the architecture, visit museums like MASP, and soak in the vibrant atmosphere. Street performers, food vendors, and diverse crowds make it a truly unique experience.
points_of_interest.address: Avenida Paulista, São Paulo - SP, Brazil

points_of_interest.name: Museu de Arte de São Paulo Assis Chateaubriand (MASP)
points_of_interest.description_poi: MASP is one of South America's most important art museums, renowned for its collection of European and Brazilian art. Its distinctive architecture, with the main body suspended on red pillars, is a landmark in itself. Explore masterpieces by artists like Van Gogh, Renoir, and Portinari.
points_of_interest.address: Avenida Paulista, 1578 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, 01310-200, Brazil

points_of_interest.name: Parque Ibirapuera
points_of_interest.description_poi: Ibirapuera Park is São Paulo's largest and most popular park, offering a green oasis in the heart of the city. Enjoy walking trails, cycling paths, museums (like the Museu Afro Brasil), and cultural events. Relax by the lake, admire the sculptures, and escape the urban bustle.
points_of_interest.address: Avenida Pedro Álvares Cabral - Vila Mariana, São Paulo - SP, Brazil

points_of_interest.name: Japan House São Paulo
points_of_interest.description_poi: Japan House São Paulo is a cultural center dedicated to promoting Japanese culture and art. Explore exhibitions, attend workshops, and learn about Japanese traditions. The building itself is a striking example of modern architecture, blending Japanese and Brazilian design elements.
points_of_interest.address: Avenida Paulista, 52 - Bela Vista, São Paulo - SP, 01310-000, Brazil

points_of_interest.name: Edifício Copan
points_of_interest.description_poi: Edifício Copan is a iconic residential building designed by Oscar Niemeyer. Its distinctive curved facade and massive scale make it a landmark in downtown São Paulo. Take a guided tour to learn about its history and architecture, or simply admire it from the outside.
points_of_interest.address: Avenida Ipiranga, 200 - República, São Paulo - SP, 01046-010, Brazil

opening_hours.general: varies, check website for tour schedules
